meanings.definition: To cultivate (cells or tissues) together in the same medium.
meanings.sent1: The scientists cocultured different types of cells to study their interactions.
meanings.sent2: In the lab, cells are often cocultured to observe how they behave in a shared environment.
meanings.sent3: The cells decided to have a party and cocultured in the petri dish.
meanings.sent4: The ideas cocultured in her mind, sparking new creativity.
meanings.sent5: The flowers and the bees cocultured in perfect harmony, creating a beautiful ecosystem.

meanings.definition: To grow (cells or tissues) together in the same environment.
meanings.sent1: Researchers cocultured the cells to see if they would thrive together.
meanings.sent2: When cocultured, these tissues show enhanced growth compared to when they are separate.
meanings.sent3: The cells cocultured like best friends, always sticking together.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship cocultured over time, becoming stronger with each passing day.
meanings.sent5: The plants cocultured in the sunlight, reaching for the sky in unison.
